ActorTalk: No need to go that far. I care more about capturing our moments as they are, not how perfect the pictures look.
Even when we're apart, we can still take little snapshots and add them in.
And even though we're not together at the time, when I see those photos, I'll feel like you're right there with me.
Yes. Looking back on them over time will feel like walking through all our shared memories again.
Should we put the Dreamweaver photos at the beginning of the album?
The staff said those need a bit of processing first. Let's add them later.
But the album's already set up. We can't leave it empty. We should add something to it now.
When we have time, let's visit the Dreamweaver and take some new photos.
Sure. As long as it's with you, I'm happy to.
No matter what kind of scenery awaits, I believe it'll make a perfect addition to our memories.
Let's go, Commandant. Our journey starts now, into our very own Dreamweaver world.

Then maybe I should practice taking better photos?
Kinda like a message board or a photo diary?
